H0.text: Homologous are biological features from a common evolutionary origin.

H1.text: Monologous are biological features from a common evolutionary origin.

H2.text: Heterologous are biological features from a common evolutionary origin.

H3.text: Analogous are biological features from a common evolutionary origin.

A4.text: Homology is similarity in anatomical structures or genes between organisms of different taxa due to shared ancestry.

A5.text: The opposite of homologous organs are analogous organs which do similar jobs in two taxa that were not present in their most recent common ancestor but, rather, evolved separately.
